page.title: 04R.A.F. COLLEGE CRANWELL
page.content: The main function of Cranwell College is to train future officers for the Royal Air Force. The planes which are used for training young pilots are Jet Provosts. Cranwell camp has lots of clubs, these include tennis, golf and squash. There are many other facilities for officers stationed at Cranwell. There are three officers messes, which are called York house, Trenchard hall and College hall. R.A.F. Cranwell is like a town, because we have our own medical and dental centres. There are two main residential areas, one is the Airmen's Married Quarters, which is near the school,the other is the Officers' Married Quarters. There is one Primary School, which also serves local villages, and a Nursery School for younger children. The camp has its own banks, shops and a post office.
